title: Nan Goldin: Intimate Life
description: A micro-lesson that makes Nan Goldin: Intimate Life usable.

hook.text: She photographed her bruised face after her boyfriend beat her. Then she published it. Nan Goldin hid nothing.

buildup.text: Goldin's 'Ballad of Sexual Dependency' documented her world â€” lovers, drag queens, addiction, nightlife â€” in raw color.

discovery.text: She presented her work as slideshows with music, blurring the line between art, diary, and confession.

twist.text: Her honesty about addiction became activism. She led protests against the Sackler family's role in the opioid crisis.

climax.text: Goldin proved that the most personal stories can be the most universal. Vulnerability is strength.

punchline.text: She turned her pain into everyone's truth.

quiz.question: What cause did Goldin champion through activism?
options: Protesting the Sackler family's role in the opioid crisis
